answers.answer: Hi,Thanks for writing in.It is important to rule out history of smoking and alcohol intake as both these conditions can cause white matter spots in the brain. Also it is mportant to rule out history of chronic headaches.Your symptoms are non specific and at this point it is very difficult to say if they are due to demyelinating disease like MS.Do you have a history of viral encephalitis?I think he best course of action would be to wait and watch and get another MRI done after 6 months to see if the lesions have grown in size or numbers because as of now it is very difficult to give a diagnosis because your symptoms could well be because of fatigue, chronic fatigue syndrome or fibromyalgia.

question: HiI receieved the results of my MRI today and it said that I have deep white matter hyperintensities.  I am 24 years old, my history inculdes pain for the past 2 years in my upper body and shoulders, some nerve twitching for the past 2 months.  The pain really  gets worst when I get tired.  I don't have high BP, diabetes, injury, dementia and I am not elderly, so please tell me what does white matter hyperintensites mean.  The impression said that in this age group consider demyleinating disease, viral syndrome or autoimmune conditions.  I have been tested for lupus and that came back negative.  I am really concerned about this MRI results.  Please help me understand them
title: white matter, degenrative?
